solution_line_template: First find the total distance Carson walks along the warehouse's long sides: {long_side} feet/side * {num_long_sides} sides = <<{long_side}*{num_long_sides}={long_sides_distance}>>{long_sides_distance} feet

Then find the total distance Carson walks along the warehouse's short sides: {short_side} feet/side * {num_short_sides} sides = <<{short_side}*{num_short_sides}={short_sides_distance}>>{short_sides_distance} feet

Add those two amounts to find the total distance walk in one circle: {long_sides_distance} feet + {short_sides_distance} feet = <<{long_sides_distance}+{short_sides_distance}={distance_per_circle}>>{distance_per_circle} feet
Then find the number of circles Carson actually walks: {supposed_circles} circles - {skipped_circles} circles = <<{supposed_circles}-{skipped_circles}={actual_circles}>>{actual_circles} circles

Then multiply the distance of one circle by the number of circles Carson makes: {distance_per_circle} feet/circle * {actual_circles} circles = <<{distance_per_circle}*{actual_circles}={total_distance}>>{total_distance} feet
